### Blog

Latest from the blog



```{r}
#| label: setup callback
#| echo: false
#| message: false


library(curl)
library(stringr)

# Fetch the main blog webpage
url <- "https://wedata.ch/blog"
webpage <- curl_fetch_memory(url)

# Convert raw content to character
html_content <- rawToChar(webpage$content)

# Regex to find all blog post links
link_pattern <- 'href="\\./blog/([^/]+)/index\\.html"'
link_matches <- regmatches(html_content, gregexpr(link_pattern, html_content, perl=TRUE))[[1]]

# Process links to clean and construct full URLs
links <- unique(gsub('href="|"', '', link_matches))
links <- paste0("https://wedata.ch/", links)

# Function to fetch and check author for a single link
check_author <- function(link) {
  # Fetch blog post content
  post_page <- curl_fetch_memory(link)
  post_content <- rawToChar(post_page$content)
  
  # Regex to check for the author
  author_pattern <- 'name=\"author\" content=\"David Munoz Tord\"'
  if (grepl(author_pattern, post_content)) {
    # Extract the title and date if the author matches
      pattern <- '<title>We Data - \\s*([^<]+)\\s*</title>'
      content <- stringr::str_match(post_content, pattern)[,2]
      
      # Trim whitespace (if any)
      content <- trimws(content)
    

      # date
      pattern <- '<p class=\"date\">\\s*([^<]+)\\s*</p>'
      date <- stringr::str_match(post_content, pattern)[,2]
      
      # Trim whitespace (if any)
      date <- trimws(date)

    
    return(list(content = content, date = date, link = link))
  }
  return(NULL)
}

# Iterate through the links, stopping after finding the author or checking N links
max_checks <- 10
result <- NULL

for (i in seq_len(min(length(links), max_checks))) {
  result <- check_author(links[i])
  if (!is.null(result)) break
}

# Output the result
if (!is.null(result)) {
  link <- result$link
  content <- result$content
  date <- result$date
} else {
  print("No articles found authored by David Munoz Tord within the first N links.")
}


```
